At 11:17 23/06/2004, I wrote:
> >So, if I set the pointer to the value of the first function, and then call
> >that function a million times in a loop, then for those million calls, it is
> >as efficient as a direct call, yes?  But then when I exit the inner loop and
> >then move the pointer to the next function in the list, then the first time
> >I call it I will likely get a pipeline stall.
>
>As efficient as a direct call, but less efficient than an inline call (for
>those calls that do inline well, a _vast_ function will not).

Sorry, very slightly less efficient than a direct call, as the function 
pointer has to be completely fetched _before_ the call can begin, so there 
may be a lesser stall for that.  But the branch won't mis-predict.

         Ian Badcoe
